Class BirthdaySolver

java.lang.Object
BirthdaySolver
public class BirthdaySolver
extends java.lang.Object
Finds the probability that in a set of people there will be two who share the same birthday.

This implementation does NOT consider leap years, only standard years

    BirthdaySolver()

    double calculateActualProbability​(int numberOfPeople)

  • Constructor Details

    • BirthdaySolver

      public BirthdaySolver()

  • Method Details

    • printUsage

      public void printUsage()
      Informs the user of the correct way to run the program when they have made an entry error. It also exits the program, assuming that the user error will cause an un-runnable condition.

    • calculateActualProbability

      public double calculateActualProbability​(int numberOfPeople)
      Calculates the actual probability that from a certain number of people, at least two of them share the same birthday. Based on calculating the probability that they DO NOT share a birthday, then subtracting that probability from 1.0 to get the other side of the coin.
      Parameters:
      numberOfPeople - integer number of people in the sample
      Returns:
      double the probability value, range between zero and one
      See Also:
      Assignment Page, Better Explained Page, Wikipedia Page

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is the main method of the program. It first verifies the arguments from the command line, then does a loop to calculate an approximate probability. After that, it calls the calculateActualProbability method and then displays both results for comparison.
      Parameters:
      args - two are used: [0] = number of people; [1] = number of experiments.
